content: I plan to incorporate the comments for rfc#3085 today or over the weekend. So far though things are looking pretty good on it.

Hey @simulacrum or @Manish Goregaokar -- are there remaining concerns to be resolved on rfc#3085? The only thing I can think is to add a note about edition idioms, i.e., to address what @Eric Huss wrote here, but it seems like a minor point. I think that if we do wind up fixing the impl so that we can have the same lint belong to both a normal group and an edition-related group that is used by cargo fix (and can be enabled indiscriminately), then i'd be happy to designate some lints as "edition idiom lints" (in my mind, then, they'd be both regular style lints, fixing things to look better in the new edition, and also idiom lints, in that they're targeting new code styles enabled by the edition).
Otherwise, it'd be nice to kick off an FCP
I'll need to do a re-review, but I otherwise am not aware of blockers
as it so happens it was already on my todo list :)
that said as I'm sure you can guess my todo list is rather hectic, so it might be this weekend or so :)
ok. FYI, we are working on a blog post that will introduce the edition a bit, and in particular describe the current candidate features
the list is basically finalized at this point
some notes in the minutes from today's call
(look at the bottom "Blog post summary / outline")
I don't have any concerns from my side
I wasn't sure if it was blocked on me but feel free to ping if something is!
@simulacrum we probably can make time in triage to quickly discuss fcp merging it?
Yeah, though I don't think it needs to be blocked on a discussion
